intro: Cissus latifolia, commonly known as the stonecrop fig or umbrella plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Convulvulaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by edible, fig-like fruits. Cissus latifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions. It is also valued for its ability to thrive in rocky or arid environments.
